answers.answer: I know that gestational diabetes is actually pretty commonBut that doesn't mean you will be diabetic after birth!

My hubby is type 1 and manages really well. Just follow the diet, test your sugars,  and get light exercise and it will be fine! If you are proactive it's no big deal. Honestly lots of Mom's have great pregnancies even with GD. So it's possible and yes your life will require more planning. But trust me, it will all be worth it and you can handle it!

I had it really bad to the point of self injecting insulin everyday. I gained a tonne of weight, but as soon as my son was born it literally disappeared :) I was also induced 2 weeks early and my son weighed 6pounds. Contrary to what everyone says, not all gestational diabetic babies are big.
